U.S. and S. Korean troops to stage joint mine warfare exercise 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces will stage a joint mine warfare exercise for a war of aggression in the sea off Pusan on July 10 and 11 together with the South Korean army, according to Seoul-based Yonhap News.
 The exercise will be participated in by the U.S. navy's only mine battle flagship "Inchon" carrying more than 1,400-strong naval force and minelayers and minesweepers of the South Korean navy.    
 A high-ranking official of South Korea said on July 8 that the exercise is aimed to cope with the enemy army's blockade of ports by large-scale minelaying and that this is the first entry into South Korean port and participation in the drill of 18,000-ton warship "Inchon" capable of carrying such equipment as various kinds of transport and attack helicopters for landing operations and over 2,000-strong  landing forces.

Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the head of the Chinese goodwill delegation.
 It was handed to Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on July 9 by Jiang Chunyun, member of the political bureau of the central committee of the Communist Party of China and vice-chairman of the standing committee of the national people's congress of the People's Republic of China, who is heading the Chinese goodwill delegation on a visit to Korea.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation
DPRK goodwill delegation leaves for China
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese delegation 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the delegation of the all-china journalists association.
 It was handed to an official concerned by Liu Dizhong, deputy editor-in-chief of "china daily" who is heading the delegation on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Il and senior officials of state
articles.content:
DPRK goodwill delegation leaves for China 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK goodwill delegation headed by Kim Yun Hyok, secretary of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today left Pyongyang for china to participate in celebrations of the 40th anniversary of the signing of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Su Hak, minister of public health, who is chairman of the central committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of foreign affairs, officials concerned and Li Bin, minister-councillor of the Chinese embassy here.
